Here, I will be sharing tutorials, tips, and best practices for all things Magento 2. Follow my blog and let’s learn and grow together.

nodes.title: How To Change Default Placeholder Image In Magento 2
nodes.excerpt: As an online store owner using Magento 2, you might have observed that the default placeholder image displayed when a product image is unavailable or hasn’t been uploaded yet may not match your branding or style. Luckily, Magento 2 provides the flexibility to modify the default placeholder image to align it with your website’s visual … Read more
nodes.content:
As an online store owner using Magento 2, you might have observed that the default placeholder image displayed when a product image is unavailable or hasn’t been uploaded yet may not match your branding or style. Luckily, Magento 2 provides the flexibility to modify the default placeholder image to align it with your website’s visual appeal. In this guide, we will provide you with step-by-step instructions to customize the default placeholder image in Magento 2, enhancing the professional and personalized appearance of your website. So, let’s dive into how to change default placeholder image in Magento 2.

How to Change the Default Placeholder Image in Magento 2: A Step-by-Step Guide

WHAT IS MAGENTO 2 PLACEHOLDER IMAGE?

The Magento 2 change product placeholder image is a feature within the Magento 2 platform that allows users to customize the temporary image displayed on the product list page when an official product image is not yet available. This functionality is particularly useful in various scenarios where there is a need to modify the default placeholder image used by Magento 2. For example, if you’re preparing to go live with a new product but the official image is not yet ready, you may use a Placeholder Image to generate customer interest and improve your SEO results. Additionally, Placeholder Images can be used for front-end testing when full content is not yet available, or to avoid interrupting the customer experience in the event of technical issues.

HOW TO CHANGE MAGENTO 2 PLACEHOLDER IMAGE?

Magento 2 uses its own logo as the default placeholder image, but changing it to a product image is a straightforward process. Here is a Guide on How to change placeholder Images in Magento 2.

1. To begin, navigate to the Admin sidebar and select “Stores” from the dropdown menu. Then, click on “Settings” and select “Configuration” from the options provided.

2. In the configuration panel, look for the “Catalog” tab and select it. This will take you to the Catalog Settings page.

3. On the Catalog Settings page, you’ll see an option for “Product Image Placeholders“. Expand this section by clicking on the expansion icon.

4. For each image role, which includes small, base, and thumbnail images, click on the “Choose File” button and select the image you want to upload from your computer. It’s important to note that the images you select should have the same dimensions as the default images for a clean and consistent look.

5. Finally, click “Save” to save your changes, and your new placeholder images will be applied to your Magento 2 store.

Conclusion

Changing the default placeholder image in Magento 2 is a simple and effective way to personalize your online store and make it stand out from the crowd. By following the step-by-step guide outlined in this tutorial, including how to get product image URL in Magento 2, you can upload custom images that align with your branding and styleIf you’re aiming to capture customer attention for a recent product, conducting frontend tests prior to complete content readiness, or simply desiring to maintain a smooth customer journey, Magento 2 offers a valuable solution through its default placeholder images. By personalizing these placeholder images, you have the opportunity to elevate the aesthetic appeal of your online store and establish an immersive shopping encounter for your valued customers. Wondering how to change the default placeholder image in Magento 2, Read on to discover the step-by-step process.

Here, I will be sharing tutorials, tips, and best practices for all things Magento 2. Follow my blog and let’s learn and grow together.
